results.title: The City changes
results.creator_credit: Andrew Janczak and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: As people’s needs change, cities must grow and change to meet these needs. Some changes are obvious; others are subtle. How do they affect people? Can all changes be considered improvements? Designed with minimum narration - and open-ended - allows students to observe and analyze reasons for change and to determine the degree to which the community can or should exercise control over change.

results.title: The City and the self
results.brief_description: Presents a study of human relations in the city based on psychological concepts formulated by Professor Stanley Milgram. Examines the city dwellers’ perception of their city and their behavior in created situations.

results.title: The Circus baby
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
Tells the story of the mother elephant who learns that she should not try to get her baby to act like a human. Iconographic animation. From the book written and illustrated by Maud and Miska Petersham. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: The Cinematographer with Enzo Martinelli
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Bruce Seth Greer
results.brief_description: Featuring cinematographer Enzo Martinelli whose job it is to interpret the film story photographically and bring a motion picture to life. The film shows how every facet of the operation is handled, how decisions are taken and the work which influences the mood and impact of a picture. The viewer learns about visual styles and techniques which make creative editing possible.

results.title: The Cinematographer
results.brief_description: Directors of photography are members of the American Society of Cinematography. Produecrs and directors rely on them to integrate costumes, make-up, sets, and all production operations. Besides knowing how to operate cameras, lenses, dollies and lighting equipment, cinematographers must be artists in using light in ways most appropriate to the subject. The film includes several illustrative scenes, mostly concerned with lighting problems, from “Picture of Dorian Gray” and “Great Expectations”.

results.title: The Chromosomes of man
results.brief_description: Methods of preparing cells for chromosome study in the laboratory. Photomicrography of cell division shows how chromosomes split and build up two daughter sets with the same number of chromosomes. The film also shows abnormal arrangements and concludes with the analysis used in studies of cancer.

results.title: The Christmas visitor
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, Phoenix Films and John Halas
results.brief_description: Presents an animated adaptation of Clement Moore’s poem entitled A visit from St. Nicholas. While Santa is resting, the toys from his bundle burst forth in a flurry of activity and the adventure of Christmas begins.

results.title: The Christmas burglars
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: Christmas morning brings an unexpected pleasant surprise for a desperate mother and her young daughter. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Adele DeGarde, Charles Inslee, George Gebhardt, Mack Sennett, Harry Solter. Silent film with English intertitles.
